sub_topic: Solving nonlinear equations using Newton-Raphson method
message_1: Find the roots of the equation f(x) = x^3 - 2x^2 - 5 using the Newton-Raphson method, with an initial guess of x0 = 2, accurate to two decimal places.
message_2:
The Newton-Raphson method is an iterative method to find the roots of a function. The formula for the method is:

x1 = x0 - f(x0) / f'(x0)

where x0 is the initial guess, x1 is the updated guess, f(x0) is the value of the function at x0, and f'(x0) is the value of the derivative of the function at x0.

Given the function f(x) = x^3 - 2x^2 - 5, we first find its derivative:

f'(x) = 3x^2 - 4x

Now, we can apply the Newton-Raphson method with the initial guess x0 = 2:

1st iteration:
x1 = 2 - ( (2^3 - 2(2^2) - 5) / (3(2^2) - 4(2)) )
x1 = 2 - ( (8 - 8 - 5) / (12 - 8) )
x1 = 2 - ( -5 / 4 )
x1 = 2 + 1.25
x1 = 3.25

2nd iteration:
x2 = 3.25 - ( (3.25^3 - 2(3.25^2) - 5) / (3(3.25^2) - 4(3.25)) )
x2 ≈ 3.25 - ( (34.328125 - 2(10.5625) - 5) / (33.15625 - 13) )
x2 ≈ 3.25 - ( (34.328125 - 21.125 - 5) / (20.15625) )
x2 ≈ 3.25 - ( 8.203125 / 20.15625 )
x2 ≈ 3.25 - 0.407
x2 ≈ 2.843

3rd iteration:
x3 = 2.843 - ( (2.843^3 - 2(2.843^2) - 5) / (3(2.843^2) - 4(2.843)) )
x3 ≈ 2.843 - ( (22.961 - 2(8.087) - 5) / (24.261 - 11.372) )
x3 ≈ 2.843 - ( (22.961 - 16.174 - 5) / (12.889) )
x3 ≈ 2.843 - ( 1.787 / 12.889 )
x3 ≈ 2.843 - 0.139
x3 ≈ 2.704

Since the difference between x2 and x3 is less than 0.01, we can stop the iterations here. The root of the equation f(x) = x^3 - 2x^2 - 5, accurate to two decimal places, is approximately x = 2.70.
